page.title: 09ROWFANT HOUSE
page.content: Rowfant House was built in the 15th. century and enlarged several times subsequently. For most of its 500 years it was a family home. Originally the{Whitfields,}who were{ironmasters, owned Rowfant House. In the 19th. century{Fredrick Locker Lampson}lived there. Mr Locker Lampson was a{poet and{bibliophile}and Rowfant became the meeting place of many{Victorian {literary figures.}During{World War 2 it was occupied by{Canadian soldiers. In 1954 it was taken over by the {Latvian Church in England}and since then it has been used as a home for {Latvian refugees.}There are now 30 residents, all retired. The grounds cover 21 acres and there is a{social {club}and an{angling club.}There are rooms for people to spend their {holidays}at Rowfant.
